title: Stiba
author: Stiba
content: Hi friensIs this a scam?I invested $ 2,000 in the TRX-DeFi Mining pool through Tronlink Pro. A few days later I got the following message when I started Tronlink:"Notification SystemHello, dear user, you have been identified by the system as a high-potential customer of our company. You are fortunate to become a pledge user and obtain pledge rights. You will be able to earn 15% of your principal every day. The staking activity expires on May 13th. Please apply to staking as soon as possible. In addition you can receive additional rewards after applying for staking. "I accepted the offer and applied.After signing up, I received a new message:"Hello, dear user, congratulations on your successful signing and pledge, the system will automatically transfer your USDT to our mining pool system, you will be in our contract for 20days, during the contract period you can get 15% of the income every day And during the pledge period, you can increase the amount, and the increased amount during the pledge period can also get 15% of the daily income, and you can receive additional rewards after the pledge ends.Thank you for supporting our DeFi mining pool system and have a nice day. "After a few days, the system sends me a new message that reads:Hello, dear user, you have become a pledge member, you can get 15% of the principal every day. During the pledge period, you must complete the tasks of the DEFI system so that you can get higher returns. You need to deposit 3000 USDT and the DEFI system will reward you with 1500 USDT. All add up to 4500 USDT will be deposited into your mining pool. You need to do it by May 18st. Otherwise, it will be considered as your default, and the DEFI system will freeze your income. "My question is, has anyone had the same or similar experiences.Is it a scam?I need your advice on what to do. Thank you.http://

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: 1000% Ponzi scam and how the hck you invest 2000$ to a defi app without doing research first? DeFi should not contact you via email since all transactions should be decentralized and doesn't need conversation from the defi side The percentage return per day is so high and the thing that requiring you to do certain things just to get more benefits is red flag already. You should avoid that service because that is not DeFi! DeFi means Decentralized Finance that doesn't require you to create account using email. You just need to connect your wallet to interact on a real DeFi. Sorry for your loss and cheer up!

comments.author: Stiba
comments.body: Hi againI did not mention in my first post that I invested money in my Mining Fund in the following way:I was contacted by a girl who said WhatsApp and introduced herself as Sarah from Ukraine but that she currently lives in Paris. After a normal conversation she told me that there are great opportunities to make money through cryptocurrencies.She persuaded me to invest $ 150 to start with.She explained everything to me and helped step by step. First I downloaded the OKX application. Through this app I bought Crypto which has been converted to TRX.The next step was to download the Tronlink pro app. I registered on that app. When I did that, with her help, I came to the wallet address that I copied. After that I went back to the OKX app and set up a TRX transfer to my walet address I got on Tronlink. The next step was again on Tronlink where I typed the following link https://deif.etc-defi918.xyz to log in to my walet or My Pool. When I logged in I saw my minings pool and the corresponding amount I had invested in TRX.Everything is still fine, I still have no doubt. After two or three days, Sarah started persuading me to invest more money because the profit would be higher. I listened to her and invested another $ 1,850 on two occasions. So $ 2,000 in total.The continuation of the story is in my first post.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Classic scam scheme. Unfortunately, your money is lost and you can do nothing about it.There is a ton of topics mentioned on how to prevent being scammed, in case common sense fails, you can only take it as a lesson and head over to https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5364418.msg58120908#post_point151 thread. There is a various discussion about how to notice and smells scammy behaviour. I suggest you take a look over that link.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Do not re-enter larger funds into that platform. Up to this point you have basically lost $2k of your money to scammers.If you want at least a small part of your funds back, you (somehow) try to persuade the scammer by pretending you are still in the scam scenario and saying "I will invest more after my first investment pays off". But remember my first suggestion.

comments.author: bitcub
comments.body: If you are about to invest in a Defi. Make sure it is a big defi site. Do not get attracted with small defi sites claiming to give you high APR. Chances most of these sprout defi sites are scams. Make sure to it is credible and lots of people are already trading on it.
